questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of a segue in iOS?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To navigate between view controllers", "B": "To animate the transition between views", "C": "To handle user input", "D": "To manage memory"}
questions.explanation: A segue is used to navigate between view controllers in an iOS app. This allows for a smooth and intuitive user experience.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'Storyboard' in Xcode?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To design the layout of a user interface", "B": "To create and manage database connections", "C": "To write code for an app's functionality", "D": "To test an app's performance"}
questions.explanation: The Storyboard in Xcode is used to design the layout of a user interface, allowing developers to create and arrange UI elements visually. This makes it easier to plan and implement the app's UI.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the `@objc` attribute in Swift?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To make a class accessible from Objective-C code", "B": "To enable ARC (Automatic Reference Counting)", "C": "To create a singleton class", "D": "To implement a protocol"}
questions.explanation: The `@objc` attribute is used to make Swift classes and properties accessible from Objective-C code, allowing for interoperability between the two languages. This is particularly useful when working with existing Objective-C frameworks or libraries.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the `@objc` attribute in Swift?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To make a class or method accessible from Objective-C", "B": "To enable ARC (Automatic Reference Counting)", "C": "To create a protocol", "D": "To use a third-party framework"}
questions.explanation: The `@objc` attribute is used to make Swift classes and methods accessible from Objective-C, allowing for interoperability between the two languages. This is particularly useful when working with existing Objective-C code or frameworks.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of using a delegate in iOS?
questions.options_json: {"A": "To pass data between view controllers", "B": "To handle asynchronous tasks", "C": "To communicate with other classes or objects", "D": "To manage memory allocation"}
questions.explanation: A delegate is an object that receives notifications from another class when a specific event occurs. In iOS, delegates are commonly used to handle events such as button clicks or network requests.
